title: How to enable a developer option in any Android device - Quora

response.answer_text: Find your Android Build number Before you can enable Developer options on your Android phone or tablet, you'll first need to find your phone's build number. On most phones, you can simply type build number into the search field, but here's how to find it on a few popular devices: IDG The Build number on your Android phone is in a different place on every phone, but it's easy enough to find. Google Pixel: Settings > System > About phone > Build number Samsung Galaxy S8 and later: Settings > About phone > Software information > Build number LG G6 and later: Settings > About phone > Software info > Build number HTC U11 and later: Settings > About > Software information > More > Build number OnePlus 5T and later: Settings > About phone > Build number Reveal Developer options Once you’ve found the screen with your Build number, you'll need to tap on it seven seven times. That's right: seven times. After a few taps, you'll see a small pop-up alert telling you that "You are now X steps away from being a developer" with a number that counts down with every additional tap.
Go to the phone settings, go to the about phone section .. scroll down to find the build number and tap that box at least times, not too quickly… this will enable developer mode in any android devicr
